result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J. Mrazek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days to pay or CV Judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles J. Mrazek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Charles J. Mrazek, appeared with Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Defendant is sentenced to 30 days in the Kenosha County Jail commencing on 4/9/16 at 8:00 AM.  Court will authorize Huber & Work Crew as set forth on the record.     Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $3000 plus costs & surcharge and is due in 30 days or Civil Judgment.  Appeal Rights given.
Deft reporting for mandatory time 4-9-16 - fine due date is deferred until 5-3-16 - To call for pp on 5-3-16 or to talk about signing up for wc.
Sentencing hearing at 03-28-2016 10:00 a.m.  Date changed from 3/29/16 at 9:30 a.m. on the Court's own motion.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 3/29/16 at 9:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is resolved.  At request of Atty Cafferty, plea hearing set for 1/28/16 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. Cafferty was recently retained by def.  FPT 12/11/15 at 9:20.  Bond continued.
At request of Atty Cafferty and with OK of ADA Binger, status conf. on 11/18/15 at 10:20 changed to 11/20/15 at 9:10.
filed by Atty. Patrick Cafferty  kmk

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Charles J. Mrazek, appeared.  Clerk: PT
DE is waiving his right to an attorney and signs waiver of rights.  DE states he is not happy with the States offer and would like to look into hiring an attorney this week.  Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 10:20 am.
of right to preliminary hearing
Scheduling Order

Attorney T. Binger for State. DE in person, pro se. Matter has previously been set over twice. DE previously provided with forms for Advocate Counsel. DE states he is unable to afford an attorney and would like to proceed. DE has reviewed petition for Advocate Counsel and does not wish to apply. Court advises DE will continue to have an ability to petition for appointment of Advocate Counsel. DE ackonwledges Court and indciates he oes wish to proceed and waives preliminary hearing. Court takes brief recess to allow DE to review and sign Waiver forms. DE advised of rights and waives. Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over fto Branch 8. Information filed. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the DE. Pretrial conference set for 10/20/15 at 8:30 a.m.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing at 08-28-2015 10:00 am

230pm  Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: NJurgens.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on August 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.  Deft moves to dismiss; denied.  Deft provided with petition for advocate counsel.  kmk
